content.user_title: Build production REST APIs with TDD and multi-agent orchestration
content.value_statement: Building production-ready REST APIs requires coordinating multiple specialists across planning, implementation, testing, and deployment. This skill orchestrates 12 agents through 5 phases with TDD methodology, ensuring comprehensive testing and quality gates.
actual_capabilities: Orchestrates 12 specialist agents across 5 development phases
Implements Red-Green-Refactor TDD cycles for all endpoints
Coordinates security, performance, and E2E testing in parallel
Manages blue-green deployment with canary rollout strategy
Stores and retrieves phase deliverables via memory system
Validates quality gates (90% coverage, security audit, performance benchmarks)
limitations: This is an SOP workflow, not an executable script - requires agent execution platform
Shell scripts shown are documentation examples, not deployable automation
Kubernetes and monitoring tools must be configured separately
Does not generate API code directly - orchestrates agents that do

prompt_templates.title: Initialize API Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the API development orchestration skill to build a [API_NAME] for [USE_CASE]. Include authentication, CRUD operations, and [SPECIFIC_REQUIREMENTS]. Start from Phase 1.

prompt_templates.title: Add New Endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new endpoint [ENDPOINT_PATH] to the [API_NAME] using TDD methodology. Follow the Red-Green-Refactor cycle with >90% test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Phase 4 security testing on [API_NAME]. Include OWASP Top 10 validation, SQL injection testing, and penetration testing report.

prompt_templates.title: Production Deploy
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute Phase 5 deployment for [API_NAME] using blue-green strategy with canary rollout. Verify monitoring dashboards and establish rollback procedures.

output_examples.input: Build a user management API with authentication, profile management, and role-based access control using TDD methodology
output: Phase 1: Planning (2 days) - Define 15 endpoints including /register, /login, /profile, /users, and role-based /admin/* routes
Phase 2: Setup (2 days) - Initialize Node.js/Express with TypeScript, PostgreSQL schema with users and roles tables
Phase 3: TDD (6 days) - Red-Green-Refactor for each endpoint targeting 94% coverage
Phase 4: Testing (2 days) - E2E workflows, load testing (1000 req/sec), OWASP security audit
Phase 5: Deployment (2 days) - Blue-green deployment with 10%/50%/100% canary rollout, monitoring active

best_practices: Always complete Phase 1 planning before implementation - OpenAPI spec and database schema are foundations for all subsequent phases
Enforce TDD discipline - never write implementation code until failing tests exist (RED before GREEN)
Pass all quality gates before deployment - zero critical security issues, >90% coverage, performance targets met
anti_patterns: Skipping TDD red phase and writing implementation first - leads to low coverage and untested edge cases
Ignoring Phase 4 security validation - OWASP Top 10 issues often only caught through dedicated testing
Deploying without monitoring - production issues become untraceable without metrics and alerting

faq.question: What AI tools are supported?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code - all support the multi-agent orchestration workflow commands.

faq.question: How long does full API development take?
faq.answer: The workflow spans 14 days with 5 phases, though simpler APIs may complete faster.

faq.question: Can I integrate with existing CI/CD?
faq.answer: Yes - GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, and other CI tools integrate with Phase 2 setup.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only orchestrates agents - no data leaves your environment. Memory stores are local.

faq.question: What if tests fail during deployment?
faq.answer: Blue-green deployment includes automatic rollback if error rate exceeds 1% during canary phases.

faq.question: How does this compare to other API frameworks?
faq.answer: This is a workflow orchestration skill, not a framework. It coordinates specialized agents vs writing code directly.
